citation.article-title: Enterococcus raffinosus sp. nov., Enterococcus solitarius sp. nov. and Enterococcus pseudoavium sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Enterococcus solitarius sp. nov.
Cells are ovoid and occur in pairs or short chains.
The cells are Gram-positive, nonmotile and non-pigmented.
Growth occurs at 10 and 45°C, and in 6.5% NaCl.

Acid is produced from N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, fructose, galactose, β-gentiobiose, galactose, gluconate, mannose, mannitol, maltose, melezitose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose, D-tagatose, trehalose and D-turanose.

Acid is not produced from D-arabinose, L-arabinose, adonitol, amidon, L-arabitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, glycogen, inositol, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, lactose, D-lyxose, α-methyl-D-mannoside, β-methylxyloside, rhmanose, ribose, D-xylose, L-xylose and xylitol.
Arginine dehydrolase, α-galactosidase, leucine arylamidase and pyrrolidonylarylamidase positive.
Alkaline phosphatase, β-galactosidase and β-glucuronidase negative.
Lancefield extracts react with group D antiserum.
The G + C content of DNA is 38 mol%, as determined by melting temperature.
